{{Infobox officeholder | name = Carole Crist | image = CaroleCrist.JPG | office = [[First Lady of Florida]] | governor = [[Charlie Crist]] | term_label = In role | term_start = December 12, 2008 | term_end = January 4, 2011 | predecessor = [[Columba Bush]] | successor = Ann Scott | birth_name = Carole Oumano | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|10|20}} | birth_place = [[Roslyn, New York|Roslyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States|U.S.]] | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | spouse = {{marriage|[[Charlie Crist]]|2008|2017|reason=divorced}} |children= 2 | alma_mater = [[Georgetown University]] ([[B.S.]]) | residence = [[Fisher Island, Florida]] }} '''Carole Crist''' ([[née]] '''Oumano''', formerly '''Rome)''' is an American businesswoman and former [[First Lady of Florida]]. Crist is the former wife of [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Representative]] and one-term [[List of Governors of Florida|Florida Governor]] [[Charlie Crist]], having served as [[First Lady of Florida]] from December 12, 2008, to January 4, 2011.
==Personal life == Crist was born and raised in [[Roslyn, New York]], a [[New York City]] suburb on [[Long Island]]. She is the daughter of Robert Oumano, the former president of the Franco-American Novelty Company, a family-owned [[novelty item|novelties]] business.<ref>{{cite news | title= Obituary: Franco-American's Robert Oumano | url=http://www.giftsanddec.com/article/525148-Obituary_Franco_American_s_Robert_Oumano.php | work=Gifts and Decorative Accessories | date=11 January 2001 | accessdate=21 January 2014}}</ref> The company was founded 1910 and is based in [[Glendale, Queens]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=114120936|title=Bloomberg – Are you a robot?|website=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2018-11-11}}</ref> Crist graduated ''magna cum laude'' from [[Georgetown University]] with a degree in accounting.<ref>[http://www.flgov.com/first_lady Official page of the Carole Crist as the First Lady of the State of Florida] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090321192703/http://www.flgov.com/first_lady |date=March 21, 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://tampabay.com/news/politics/state/article696253.ece |title=Meet Carole Rome, the Governor's Fiancee. |access-date=2008-10-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081104193248/http://tampabay.com/news/politics/state/article696253.ece |archive-date=2008-11-04 |url-status=dead }}</ref>
Crist has two children from her first marriage.<ref>{{cite web|author=PageSix.com Staff |url=http://www.nypost.com/p/pagesix/tears_in_family_court_Q66hXEz4ZQUxUVlgW4U1SP?CMP=OTC-rss&FEEDNAME= |title=Tears in family court | Page Six |publisher=Nypost.com |date=2011-12-01 |accessdate=2015-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Adam|title=Carole Crist regains joint custody of kids|url=http://www.tampabay.com/blogs/the-buzz-florida-politics/carole-crist-regains-custody-of-kids/2112650|publisher=Tampa Bay Times|accessdate=9 April 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140413150334/http://www.tampabay.com/blogs/the-buzz-florida-politics/carole-crist-regains-custody-of-kids/2112650|archive-date=13 April 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref>
She married [[Charlie Crist]] on December 12, 2008, at the [[First Methodist Church of St. Petersburg]].<ref name="dec08">{{cite news|last=Scott|first=Anna|coauthors=|title=Rome-Crist wedding shows how etiquette has changed|pages=|publisher=Sarasota Herald-Tribune|date=2008-12-10|url=http://www.gainesville.com/article/20081210/NEWS/812100949|accessdate=2009-06-13}}</ref>
After nine years of marriage, in February 2017, Charlie Crist filed for divorce from Carole, stating, "I think the world of Carole. She's an amazing person. It just didn't work out for us, I wish all the best for her."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.news-press.com/story/news/2017/02/24/report-charlie-crist-and-wife-get-divorce/98369640/|title=Report: Charlie Crist and wife to get divorce|website=The News-Press|language=en|access-date=2020-04-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.usanews.net/politics/carole-crist-i-will-always-love-charlie-h3923.html|title=Carole Crist: I will always love Charlie|last=USANews.net|first=|date=|website=|language=tr|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-04-18}}</ref>
Crist currently resides in [[Fisher Island, Florida]].
==Career== After her father's death in 2000, Crist ran Franco-American Novelty for the next six years. She coined the slogan ''"Where Fashion Meets Halloween"'' and changed the focus of the company to more figure-flattering, high-fashion costumes. In 2006, she handed over control of Franco-American to her sister, Michele Oumano Powell, and in January, 2013 resigned from her management position. In 2012, Crist started a new Halloween Costume business in [[St. Petersburg, Florida]] called Goddessey, L.L.C., which she sold in early 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://goddessey.com/store/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-04-18 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140418234537/http://goddessey.com/store/ |archivedate=2014-04-18 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Goddessey, L.L.C|url=http://www.florida-companies-info.com/goddessey-l-l-c-1p6i7/|publisher=Florida Companies|accessdate=18 April 2014}}</ref>
During her husband's 2016 campaign for Congress, Crist served as acting campaign director, and played a significant role in fundraising.
Crist is currently founder and CEO of CLC Global Advisors, a philanthropic and entrepreneurial venture focused on impact investing.<ref name="clc">{{cite news|last=|first=|coauthors=|title=Artists, Celebrities, and Business Moguls Unite in Miami Beach during Art Basel Week for Common Cause: to help Rebuild Puerto Rico|pages=|publisher=Impact Wealth|date=2019-12-10|url=https://impactwealthmagazine.com/?p=797|accessdate=2019-12-13}}</ref>
